breeds.name: Chihuahua
breeds.description: Not recommended in a Family with childrens. The Chihuahua is a tiny dog with a huge personality. A national symbol of Mexico, these alert and amusing purse dogs stand among the oldest breeds of the Americas, with a lineage going back to the ancient kingdoms of pre-Columbian times. The Chihuahua is a balanced, graceful dog of terrier-like demeanor, weighing no more than 6 pounds. Even tiny dogs require training, and without it this clever scamp will rule your household like a little Napoleon.

breeds.name: Yorkshire Terrier
breeds.description: With an English origin the Yorkshire Terrier is characterized by being an intelligent breed with a strong personality. They have an abundant, fine and silky coat, whose combination of black, tan and dark steel blue makes them adorable furry ones. During the first year of life they need to channel their energy through play and daily walks.

breeds.name: Bichon Maltés
breeds.description: In general, the Maltese is a happy and fun dog, as well as affectionate with its caregiver. He is a good companion dog and not lonely at all, he likes to enjoy people and pets. It has a protective nature and will love having toys and other things to chew on. It should be noted that the Maltese dog is somewhat nervous and playful and therefore suffers if it spends too much time alone at home.

breeds.name: Border Collie
breeds.excercice: 2 - 3 hours of high excercice every day
breeds.description: The ideal environment for a Border Collie is the countryside. This bright and clever breed needs constant activity and if confined will soon become unhappy and destructive.

breeds.name: Pastor Alemán
breeds.excercice: 1-2 hours of high excercice every day
breeds.description: The German Shepherd is a sociable and trainable dog by nature, which can be the perfect pet or the perfect working animal if it is trained correctly. It is very important to begin their education and socialization at approximately 3 months, since this will make it much easier to achieve a balanced animal capable of behaving correctly in all circumstances. He also usually gets along with children and other animals, but you have to be careful with his games because sometimes he does not control his strength.

breeds.name: Gran Danés
breeds.excercice: 1 hour of medium excercice every day
breeds.description: The enormous size of the Great Dane can give the wrong impression about its temperament and character. In general, these dogs are very friendly and affectionate with their own, although they can be reserved with strangers. They are not usually aggressive, but it is important to socialize them as puppies due to their tendency to be reserved with strangers. Properly socialized, they are dogs that get along well with people, other dogs, and even other pets. In this case, they are particularly good friends with children, although while they are young dogs they can be clumsy for smaller children.

breeds.name: Irish Wolfhound
breeds.excercice: 1 hour of medium excercice every day
breeds.description: It is a dog very attached to its owners, which makes it a good protector. It is also calm and docile, ideal for living with children and other pets. It has a strong herding and hunting instinct, and appreciates long walks and frequent field trips.

breeds.name: chinese crested
breeds.personality: friendly, good with people, docile, they love company
breeds.excercice: 30 minutes of low excercice every day
breeds.description: Although the Chinese Crested requires special care to keep its skin and coat in perfect condition, it is a perfect breed of dog for beginners, since its intelligence and docile nature make training it a simple task. Of course, in order to adopt this dog it is essential to have time, because it cannot spend long hours alone.
